definition: Used to specify a particular thing or person that is already known.
A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin and a crisp, white interior.
A building in which people live.
To move swiftly on foot.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain.
An electronic device that processes data and performs calculations.
Activity involving mental or physical effort done to achieve a result.
A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
An intense feeling of deep affection.
To exist, to have a specified quality.
Expressing motion in the direction of a particular location.
Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole.
Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences.
Used when referring to someone or something for the first time.
Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed.
Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard.
Possess, own, or hold.
Used by a speaker to refer to themselves.
Used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
Intended to be given to.
Used to make a word or phrase negative.
Accompanied by (another person or thing).
Used to refer to

Accompanied by (another person or thing).
Used to refer to a male person or animal.
Used in comparisons to refer to the extent or degree of something.
Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
Perform an action, the precise nature of which is often unspecified.
Expressing location or arrival in a particular place or position.
Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated.
Used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
Used by a speaker to refer to themselves and one or more other people.
Physically in contact with and supported by a surface.
Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned.
